newsitem.title: UK: FORECAST - Scottish Hydro looks to future.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Scottish Hydro looks to future.

text.p: Vertically-integrated electricity company Scottish Hydro-Electric should see half year profits up 10 percent or so on December 12 and raise its dividend, but analysts will want details on future strategy.
"The big story really is what Scottish Hydro will do with its money," said one analyst who asked not to be identified.
The company has around 500 million stg to spend, analysts said, and could choose investments, shareholder benefits or a mixture of the two.

Pre-tax profits for the six months are expected to come in between 63 and 70.7 million stg compared with 61.7 million stg a year ago while the dividend should be around 5.2 pence, up from 4.75 pence previously.
"The vision thing, that is what the market will look for," said the analyst.
Scottish Hydro saw the supply business of British Gas in Scotland and northern England slip through its hands when talks between the two companies broke down in September.
But analysts said these might not be ruled out as British Gas moves towards demerging its supply business.
Scottish Hydro has ruled out buying a regional electricity company (Rec) or water and sewerage company and analysts said it was likely to focus on investment in generating assets.
It has discussed taking full control of the Keadby power station near Scunthorpe, north east England, which it currently owns in a 50:50 joint venture with United Utilities.
Analysts said the company might invest more in independent power projects and combined heat and power (CHP) schemes as a means of increasing its presence in generation.
At the same time, it might decide to return some cash to shareholders through special dividends or a buyback, they said.
"But it might want to hang on to some funds in case those British Gas talks light up again," the analyst said.
